intro: Davallodes seramensis, commonly known as the Seram climbing fern, is a tropical plant native to the Indonesian island of Seram. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant features small, green, ovate leaves arranged in a pinnate pattern, which contribute to its ornamental appeal. It produces tiny, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, dark berries. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
